lines.text:
[part of long, mock Churchillian speech]
... the lion shall lie down with the lamb, the goat shall give suck to the tiny bee...
And in come the three bears. The Daddy Bear said, "Who's been sleeping in my porridge?" - and the mummy bear said, "that's no porridge, that was my wife!"

[On being shown her own death certificate by the nurse]
Well, you can't argue with it. I thought I was alive, but there it is in black and white... Do I lie down or something?
I hear the Pope's allowing contraceptives for all occasions, except during sexual intercourse.

[His top hat has a miniature radar on top]
I tell you, it's the latest early warning hat. It gives you that extra four minutes in bed.
I never wore a hat in bed. I've been a Catholic person for a long time now, and I wouldn't know where to begin.
British? What a lot of use that is - we don't even know who's won the war!

[at various points in film, shouting out of police car]
Keep moving!
Get your hands out of my drawers!
I always knew my inside leg would lead to power.
My advice, charge twenty quid rent, be mindful of drafts...
Remember you're the electricity man for the whole nation.
I am the BBC as you can see, and here was the last news.
Are you a doctor, doctor?
I want it privately, on the NHS.
I wish there were more people her own age on the Circle Line.
Well, you know, you've been a bit off colour.
Yes, I know, and what's more I've not been eating anything.
Why is that?
I can't get the stuff.
